definition: unable to conceal one's happiness, amazement, shock etc/grinning from ear to ear/mouth agape/gobsmacked
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
to gather together/to collect/to approach/to draw near to/to add/to sum up/to comb (hair)

sentences.english: "Good idea. She'll smile from ear to ear. "(
sentences.chinese: 好主意，她一定會笑得合不攏嘴。

sentences.english: Lately all the pictures of Hillary have her smiling from ear to ear.
sentences.chinese: 最近希拉里在所有的照片裏都笑得合不攏嘴。

sentences.english: Getting a little grandson this year, my husband's aunt is so happy that she smiled all day long.
sentences.chinese: 叔婆今年添了個小孫孫，高興得整日合不攏嘴。

sentences.english: Try our sweet corn, and you'll smile from ear to ear.
sentences.chinese: 嚐嚐我們的甜玉米，包你樂得合不攏嘴。

sentences.english: Wow, you are smiling from ear to ear.
sentences.chinese: 哇，你笑得都合不攏嘴啊。

sentences.english: Xiaotu listened, smiling all of the 1930.
sentences.chinese: 小兔聽了，笑得都合不攏嘴了。

sentences.english: Ann: Wow, you are smiling from ear to ear.
sentences.chinese: 哇，你笑得都合不攏嘴啊。
